abstract: The American International Group moved closer to the $15 billion sale of a second major life insurance unit after the Internal Revenue Service indicated that it would rule favorably on a tax issue that had stymied the deal, people briefed on the matter told DealBook.
snippet: The American International Group moved closer to the $15 billion sale of a second major life insurance unit after the Internal Revenue Service indicated that it would rule favorably on a tax issue that had stymied the deal, people briefed on the m...
lead_paragraph: 4:43 p.m. | Updated The American International Group moved closer to the $15 billion sale of a second major life insurance unit on Thursday after the Internal Revenue Service indicated that it would rule favorably on a tax issue that had stymied the deal, people briefed on the matter told DealBook.

headline.main: A.I.G. Nears Resolution of Tax Issue in Deal for Unit

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal Reserve Bank of New York

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
